p: Of the DENV cases, 84.5% (95% CI: 84.0%–85.1%) were reported from 10 Colombian departments: Antioquia (27.6%; 95% CI: 27.0%–28.2%), Valle del Cauca (25.4%; 95% CI: 25.0%–25.9%), Santander (6.9%; 95% CI: 6.7%–7.1%), Tolima (5.7%; 95% CI: 5.3%–6.1%), Cundinamarca (4.4%; 95% CI: 4.1%–5.0%), Huila (3.9%; 95% CI: 3.2%–4.1%), Risaralda (2.9%; 95% CI: 2.1%–3.1%), Norte de Santander (2.7%; 95% CI: 2.3%–3.0%), Meta (2.6%; 95% CI: 2.1%–3.0%), and Quindío (2.5%; 95% CI: 2.0%–2.8%). For severe dengue, 80.3% (95% CI: 80.0%–81.2%) of the cases were distributed as follows: Valle del Cauca (22.2%; 95% CI: 21.9%–23.0%), Tolima (13.6%; 95% CI: 13.0%–14.2%), Huila (12.5%; 95% CI: 12.1%–13.1%), Antioquia (12.3%; 95% CI: 12.1%–12.5%), Santander (7.7%; 95% CI: 7.3%–8.1%), Atlántico (3.9%; 95% CI: 3.7%–4.1%), Meta (3.1%; 95% CI: 3.0%–3.5%), Cundinamarca (2.8%; 95% CI: 2.5%–3.1%), and Norte de Santander (2.2%; 95% CI: 2.1%–2.6%).
